page.title: 12EDUCATION IN L.STAUGHTON
page.content: There is a three tier education system in North Bedfordshire.Children attend the{Kymbrook Lower School}at Keysoe when they are 5 years old.At nine they move on to{The Margaret Beaufort {Middle School at Riseley}and at thirteen years they go to{Sharnbrook {Upper School}where they remain until they are sixteen.They are then able to leave school to go to work but they can stay on at school until they are eighteen when they either commence work or attend colleges or Universities further afield. The children follow a broad curriculum covering the main areas of human experience:-aesthetic and creative,the ethical, the linguistic,the mathematical,the physical,the social and political, the scientific and the spiritual.The County Education Department provides transport.
